title: Howard Mnisi
text:
Xolane Howard Mnisi (born 13 July 1989) is a South African <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player for the in the <a href="Pro14">Pro14</a>. His regular position is centre.
Career.
Youth.
Mnisi represented the at the 2006 and 2007 Under–18 <a href="Craven%20Week">Craven Week</a> tournaments, which earned him a place in the academy. He played for their Under–19 team in 2008 and their Under–21 team in 2010.
Sharks.
In 2011, Mnisi was included in the <a href="2011%20Vodacom%20Cup">2011 Vodacom Cup</a> squad and made his debut against the .
NMMU Madibaz.
However, Mnisi failed to break into the <a href="Currie%20Cup">Currie Cup</a> team and joined <a href="Varsity%20Cup">Varsity Cup</a> side instead. He was included in the <a href="South%20African%20Universities%20rugby%20union%20team">South Africa Students</a> team in 2012 and 2013 and he was also voted as the "Back That Rocks" for the <a href="2013%20Varsity%20Cup">2013 Varsity Cup</a> tournament.
Griquas.
Mnisi had a trial with the in 2013, but joined the instead.
Golden Lions.
Mnisi moved to <a href="Johannesburg">Johannesburg</a> to join the prior to the <a href="2014%20Currie%20Cup%20Premier%20Division">2014 Currie Cup Premier Division</a> season.
South Africa 'A'.
In 2016, Mnisi was included in a <a href="South%20Africa%20%27A%27%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">South Africa 'A'</a> squad that played a <a href="2016%20mid-year%20rugby%20union%20internationals">two-match series</a> against a touring <a href="England%20Saxons">England Saxons</a> team. He was named in the starting line-up for their first match in <a href="Bloemfontein">Bloemfontein</a>, but ended on the losing side as the visitors ran out 32–24 winners. He was named on the bench for the second match of the series, coming on as a second-half replacement in a 26–29 defeat to the Saxons in <a href="George%2C%20Western%20Cape">George</a>.
